title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to klexdatr
text: outlines propose change klexdatr.

title: Contributing to klexdatr
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to klexdatr
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to klexdatr
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. Begin commit merge messages - indicate user facing changes included NEWS.md. use fledge automatically generate NEWS.md file.

title: Contributing to klexdatr
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to klexdatr
text: Please note klexdatr project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with klexdatr
text: Thanks using klexdatr! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with klexdatr
text: opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with klexdatr
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Kootenay Lake Exploitation Study Data
text: klexdatr R package six relational tibbles Kootenay Lake Large Trout Exploitation study.
code: ls("package:klexdatr") # the six tibbles #> [1] "capture"    "deployment" "detection"  "recapture"  "section"    #> [6] "station" library(tibble) # for prettier printing capture #> # A tibble: 245 × 9 #>    Capture DateTimeCapture     SectionCapture Species    Length Weight Reward1 #>    <fct>   <dttm>              <fct>          <fct>       <int>  <dbl>   <int> #>  1 F075    2008-05-24 10:40:00 S25            Bull Trout    545   1.75       0 #>  2 F076    2008-05-24 11:10:00 S25            Bull Trout    654   3.4        0 #>  3 F084    2008-06-05 08:01:00 S16            Bull Trout    553  NA          0 #>  4 F100    2009-05-02 13:31:00 S21            Bull Trout    643   2.75     100 #>  5 F104    2009-05-03 11:17:00 S22            Bull Trout    567   2        100 #>  6 F129    2009-05-07 09:11:00 S21            Bull Trout    703   3.9      100 #>  7 F133    2009-05-07 13:58:00 S21            Bull Trout    712   3.65     100 #>  8 F137    2009-05-08 11:16:00 S21            Bull Trout    572   1.9      100 #>  9 F141    2009-05-20 15:13:00 S16            Bull Trout    564   2.2      100 #> 10 F143    2009-05-21 08:00:00 S16            Bull Trout    595   2.4      100 #> # ℹ 235 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: Reward2 <int>, DateTimeTagExpire <dttm> recapture #> # A tibble: 54 × 8 #>    DateTimeRecapture   Capture SectionRecapture TBarTag1 TBarTag2 TagsRemoved #>    <dttm>              <fct>   <fct>            <lgl>    <lgl>    <lgl>       #>  1 2009-04-05 12:00:00 F006    S25              TRUE     TRUE     TRUE        #>  2 2009-05-23 12:00:00 F131    S16              TRUE     TRUE     TRUE        #>  3 2009-09-10 12:00:00 F097    S14              TRUE     TRUE     TRUE        #>  4 2009-10-06 12:00:00 F169    S08              TRUE     TRUE     TRUE        #>  5 2009-10-10 12:00:00 F076    S30              TRUE     TRUE     TRUE        #>  6 2009-10-12 12:00:00 F099    S10              TRUE     TRUE     TRUE        #>  7 2009-10-14 12:00:00 F112    S16              TRUE     TRUE     TRUE        #>  8 2009-10-16 12:00:00 F111    S27              TRUE     TRUE     TRUE        #>  9 2010-01-23 12:00:00 F197    S27              TRUE     TRUE     TRUE        #> 10 2010-01-28 12:00:00 F075    S23              TRUE     TRUE     TRUE        #> # ℹ 44 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: Released <lgl>, Public <lgl>

title: Kootenay Lake Exploitation Study Data
text: install latest release CRAN install developmental version GitHub

title: Kootenay Lake Exploitation Study Data
text: study ran 2008 2014 caught, tagged released large Rainbow Trout Bull Trout Kootenay Lake boat angling. fish tagged internal acoustic tags /high reward external tags subsequently detected acoustic receiver array well reported anglers. data analysed Thorley Andrusak (2017) estimate natural fishing mortality species. also shiny app view fish movement data.

title: Kootenay Lake Exploitation Study Data
text: Please report issues. Pull requests always welcome.

title: Kootenay Lake Exploitation Study Data
text: Please note klexdatr project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Kootenay Lake Exploitation Study Data
text: project primarily funded Habitat Conservation Trust Foundation. Habitat Conservation Trust Foundation created act legislature preserve, restore enhance key areas habitat fish wildlife throughout British Columbia. Anglers, hunters, trappers guides contribute projects Foundation licence surcharges. Tax deductible donations assist work Foundation also welcomed. project partially funded Fish Wildlife Compensation Program behalf program partners BC Hydro, Province B.C., Fisheries Oceans Canada, First Nations public work together conserve enhance fish wildlife impacted construction BC Hydro dams. Annual operation maintenance VR2W arrays used study completed Ministry Forests, Lands Natural Resource Operations (MFLNRO) funded Fish Wildlife Compensation Program (FWCP) conjunction Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) Northwest Power Conservation Council’s Fish Wildlife Program, co-operation Idaho Department Fish Game (IDFG), Kootenai Tribe Idaho (KTOI). Freshwater Fish Society British Columbia (FFSBC) provided tag rewards

title: Fish Capture Data — capture
text: Fish Capture Data

title: Fish Capture Data — capture
text: tbl data frame: Capture unique fish code (fctr). DateTimeCapture date time capture (time). SectionCapture section code (fint). Species fish species 'Bull Trout', 'Lake Trout' 'Rainbow Trout' (fctr). Length fork length mm (int). Weight wet mass kg (dbl). Reward1 reward value first T-Bar tag Canadian dollars (int). Reward2 reward value second T-Bar tag present Canadian dollars (int). DateTimeTagExpire acoustic tag expiration date time (time).

title: Receiver Deployment Data — deployment
text: data frame receiver deployments station date times.

title: Receiver Deployment Data — deployment
text: tbl data frame: Station station name (fctr). Receiver receiver code (fctr). DateTimeReceiverIn receiver deployment date time (time). DateTimeReceiverOut receiver retrieval date time (time).

title: Acoustic Detection Data — detection
text: Hourly acoustic detection data fish (capture) receiver.

title: Acoustic Detection Data — detection
text: tbl data frame: DateTimeDetection detection date hour (time). Capture fish code (fctr). Receiver receiver code (fctr). Detections number detections hour (int).

what: klexdatr: Kootenay Lake Exploitation Study Data — klexdatr-package
title: klexdatr: Kootenay Lake Exploitation Study Data — klexdatr-package
text: Six relational 'tibbles' Kootenay Lake Large Trout Exploitation study. study ran 2008 2014 caught, tagged released large Rainbow Trout Bull Trout Kootenay Lake boat angling. fish tagged internal acoustic tags /high reward external tags subsequently detected acoustic receiver array well reported anglers. data analysed Thorley Andrusak (1994) doi:10.7717/peerj.2874  estimate natural fishing mortality species.

title: klexdatr: Kootenay Lake Exploitation Study Data — klexdatr-package
text: Maintainer: Joe Thorley joe@poissonconsulting.ca (ORCID) [data contributor] Authors: Greg Andrusak [data contributor] Gary Pavan [data contributor] Sarah Stephenson [data contributor] Matt Neufeld [data contributor] Jeff Burrows [data contributor] Kerry Reed [data contributor] Robyn Irvine [data contributor] Harvey Andrusak [data contributor] contributors: James Baxter [data contributor] Rob Bison [data contributor] Mike Ramsay [data contributor] Habitat Conservation Trust Foundation [copyright holder, funder] Fish Wildlife Compensation Program [copyright holder, funder] Freshwater Fish Society BC [copyright holder, funder] Ministry Environment [copyright holder, data contributor] Bonneville Power Administration [copyright holder, funder] Idaho Department Fish Game [copyright holder] Kootenai Tribe Idaho [copyright holder]

title: Fish Recapture Data — recapture
text: tbl data frame fish recaptures. time recapture reported assumed 12:00:00.

title: Fish Recapture Data — recapture
text: tbl data frame: DateTimeRecapture reported date recapture (time). Capture fish code (fctr). SectionRecapture section code (fctr). TBarTag1 first T-Bar Tag reported (lgl). TBarTag2 second T-Bar Tag reported (lgl). TagsRemoved T-Bar tags removed fish (lgl). Released angler reportedly released fish (lgl). Public angler member public opposed study team (lgl).

title: Section Data — section
text: Section Spatial Polygon Data

title: Section Data — section
text: SpatialPolygonsDataFrame data frame: Section unique section code (fctr). Habitat habitat type 'Lentic' 'Lotic' (fctr). Bounded polygon represents full area (lgl). geometry section polygon (MULTIPOLYGON (m)).

title: Section Data — section
text: Polygons sections waterbodies.

title: Station Data — station
text: tbl data frame detection stations.

title: Station Data — station
text: tbl data frame: Station unique station name (fctr). Section section code (fctr). geometry station point (POINT (m)).
